text:
An Indian died in an accident in Iraq on March 22.

N. Jagadeesh (23), hailing from Visakhapatnam and a welder by profession, had gone to Iraq in January to work for a private company.

On March 22, the wires of a makeshift winch he was on snapped and he and another worker fell and died on the spot. He was working overtime after his daily shift.

According to his co-workers and roommates, the death of Jagadeesh was kept under wraps by the company officials for over 24 hours.

“It was only when the co-workers asked the management about his whereabouts when he did not return to his room and he was not reachable on his cellphone did they reveal what had happened,” said Mr. Apparao

Efforts on to bring body

Meanwhile, attempts are being made to bring back his body, but it could take up to 10 days for it to reach Visakhapatnam.

Jagadeesh had earlier gone to Dubai in 2013-14 as helper.
title: Death of Indian worker in Iraq kept under wraps
